snippet: A new company will sell licensed smartphones that allow users unlimited free music downloads, hiding the price of the music in that of the phone.
abstract: Apple's pending $3.2 billion deal for Beats Electronics suggests watershed moment for streaming music by subscription to many in the industry; among doubters of the subscription model is Yonder, small service that sells specially licensed smartphones that allow users unlimited free downloads, plan called hard bundling.
lead_paragraph: A new company will sell licensed smartphones that allow users unlimited free music downloads, hiding the price of the music in that of the phone.

headline.main: Digital Music Service to Pose New Challenge to Subscription Model
headline.print_headline: Digital Music Service to Pose New Challenge to Subscription Model
